nl.dead_pixel.telebot.retrofit

Interface TelegramBotApiService


  • public interface TelegramBotApiService
    Retrofit Interface outlining the Telegram Bot API's endpoints.
    Since:
    2017 -05-23 11:40 CET

    • Method Detail

      • getMe

        @POST(value="getMe")
Single<ApiResponse<User>> getMe()
        A simple method for testing the bot's auth token. Requires no parameters. Returns basic information about the bot in form of a User object.
        Returns:
        Single Observable which will emit an ApiResponse object which wraps a User object

      • sendChatAction

        @POST(value="sendChatAction")
Single<ApiResponse<Message>> sendChatAction()
        Send chat action single.
        Returns:
        the single

      • kickChatMember

        @POST(value="kickChatMember")
Single<ApiResponse<Boolean>> kickChatMember(@Body
                                                                           ChatIdUserIdRequest chatIdUserIdRequest)
        Use this method to kick a user from a group or a supergroup. In the case of supergroups, the user will not be able to return to the group on their own using invite links, etc., unless unbanned first. The bot must be an administrator in the group for this to work. Returns a Single Observable which will emit an ApiResponse object which wraps a Boolean
        Parameters:
        chatIdUserIdRequest - a ChatIdUserIdRequest object, built with the ChatIdUserIdRequest.Builder#create() method
        Returns:
        Single Observable which will emit an ApiResponse object which wraps a Boolean

      • unbanChatMember

        @POST(value="unbanChatMember")
Single<ApiResponse<Boolean>> unbanChatMember(@Body
                                                                             ChatIdUserIdRequest chatIdUserIdRequest)
        Use this method to unban a previously kicked user in a supergroup or channel. The user will not return to the group or channel automatically, but will be able to join via link, etc. The bot must be an administrator for this to work. Returns a Single Observable which will emit an ApiResponse object which wraps a Boolean
        Parameters:
        chatIdUserIdRequest - a ChatIdUserIdRequest object, built with the ChatIdUserIdRequest.Builder#create() method
        Returns:
        Single Observable which will emit an ApiResponse object which wraps a Boolean

      • deleteMessage

        @POST(value="deleteMessage")
Single<ApiResponse<Boolean>> deleteMessage(@Body
                                                                         ChatIdMessageIdRequest chatIdMessageIdRequest)
        Use this method to delete a message. A message can only be deleted if it was sent less than 48 hours ago. Any such recently sent outgoing message may be deleted. Additionally, if the bot is an administrator in a group chat, it can delete any message. If the bot is an administrator in a supergroup, it can delete messages from any other user and service messages about people joining or leaving the group (other types of service messages may only be removed by the group creator). In channels, bots can only remove their own messages. Returns a Single Observable which will emit an ApiResponse object which wraps a Boolean
        Parameters:
        chatIdMessageIdRequest - a ChatIdMessageIdRequest object, built with the ChatIdMessageIdRequest.Builder#create() method
        Returns:
        Single Observable which will emit an ApiResponse object which wraps a Boolean

      • editMessageText

        @POST(value="editMessageText")
Single<ApiResponse<Object>> editMessageText(@Body
                                                                            MessageRequest messageRequest)
        Use this method to edit text and game messages sent by the bot or via the bot (for inline bots). On success, if edited message is sent by the bot, the edited Message is returned, otherwise True is returned.
        Parameters:
        messageRequest - a MessageRequest object
        Returns:
        Single Observable which will emit an ApiResponse object which wraps a Object

      • editMessageCaption

        @POST(value="editMessageCaption")
Single<ApiResponse<Object>> editMessageCaption()
        Edit message caption single.
        Returns:
        the single

        @POST(value="editMessageReplyMarkup")
Single<ApiResponse<Object>> editMessageReplyMarkup()
        Edit message reply markup single.
        Returns:
        the single

      • getChat

        @POST(value="getChat")
Single<ApiResponse<Chat>> getChat(@Body
                                                          ChatIdRequest chatIdRequest)
        Use this method to get up to date information about the chat (current name of the user for one-on-one conversations, current username of a user, group or channel, etc.). Returns a Chat object on success.
        Parameters:
        chatIdRequest - a ChatIdRequest object
        Returns:
        Single Observable which will emit an ApiResponse object which wraps a Chat object

      • getChatAdministrators

        @POST(value="getChatAdministrators")
Single<ApiResponse<List<ChatMember>>> getChatAdministrators(@Body
                                                                                                  ChatIdRequest chatIdRequest)
        Use this method to get a list of administrators in a chat. On success, returns an Array of ChatMember objects that contains information about all chat administrators except other bots. If the chat is a group or a supergroup and no administrators were appointed, only the creator will be returned.
        Parameters:
        chatIdRequest - a ChatIdRequest object
        Returns:
        Single Observable which will emit an ApiResponse object which wraps a List containing ChatMember objects.

      • getChatMembersCount

        @POST(value="getChatMembersCount")
Single<ApiResponse<Long>> getChatMembersCount(@Body
                                                                                  ChatIdRequest chatIdRequest)
        Use this method to get the number of members in a chat. Returns a Long object on success.
        Parameters:
        chatIdRequest - a ChatIdRequest object
        Returns:
        Single Observable which will emit an ApiResponse object which wraps a Long object

      • getChatMember

        @POST(value="getChatMember")
Single<ApiResponse<ChatMember>> getChatMember(@Body
                                                                            ChatIdUserIdRequest chatIdUserIdRequest)
        Use this method to get information about a member of a chat. Returns a ChatMember object on success.
        Parameters:
        chatIdUserIdRequest - a ChatIdUserIdRequest object, built with the ChatIdUserIdRequest.Builder#create() method
        Returns:
        Single Observable which will emit an ApiResponse object which wraps a ChatMember object

      • getUserProfilePhotos

        @POST(value="getUserProfilePhotos")
Single<ApiResponse<UserProfilePhotos>> getUserProfilePhotos(@Body
                                                                                                 UserProfilePhotosRequest userProfilePhotosRequest)
        Use this method to get a list of profile pictures for a user. Returns a UserProfilePhotos object.
        Parameters:
        userProfilePhotosRequest - a UserProfilePhotosRequest object generated with UserProfilePhotosRequest.Builder#create()
        Returns:
        Single Observable which will emit an ApiResponse containing a UserProfilePhotos object

      • sendMessage

        @POST(value="sendMessage")
Single<ApiResponse<Message>> sendMessage(@Body
                                                                     MessageRequest messageRequest)
        Use this method to send text messages. On success, the sent Message is returned.

        For formatting options see: https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#formatting-options

        Parameters:
        messageRequest - a MessageRequest object
        Returns:
        On Success, returns a Single Observable which will emit an ApiResponse object which wraps the sent Message object

      • forwardMessage

        @POST(value="forwardMessage")
Single<ApiResponse<Message>> forwardMessage(@Body
                                                                           ForwardRequest forwardRequest)
        Use this method to forward messages of any kind. On success, the sent Message is returned.
        Parameters:
        forwardRequest - a ForwardRequest object
        Returns:
        On Success, returns a Single Observable which will emit an ApiResponse object which wraps the sent Message object
